name: json with extra properties validation check test - demo 2.2

parameters.pythonCode:
'''
-> use case: extra property "age"
firstName,lastSurname,age
Dale,Jimenez,23
Jeremy,Coleman,21
Diana,Holt,19
Justin,Zimmerman,22
'''
import json
import jsonschema
from jsonschema import validate

studentSchema = {
  "type": "object",
  "additionalProperties": False,
  "required": [
    "firstName", 
    "lastSurname"
  ],  
  "properties": {
    "firstName": {"type": "string"},
    "lastSurname": {"type": "string"}
  }
}

def validateJson(jsonData):
  result   = True
  msg      = "Schema accepted"
  try:
    validate(instance=jsonData, schema=studentSchema)
  except jsonschema.exceptions.ValidationError as err:
    msg    = err.message
    result = False
  return result, msg

i0         = (_input.first().to_py())['json']
i1         = json.dumps(i0)
i2         = json.loads(i1)

isValid, msg = validateJson(i2)

if not isValid:
  #print((item.pairedItem).to_py()["item"])
  print("{0}".format(msg))
  print(i0)
  
return _input.all()
